channel.title: BUbreakingHeadlines
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingHeadlines, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gun store owner says shooter who killed 2 schoolchildren showed no warning signs before attack
“You’re at the beach, not a library”: Australian woman calls Americans “screaming” at beach club. Viewers say “screaming where?”

item.description: The city of Gloucester says it's identified the source of a "strong odor" that smells like rotten eggs.

item.title: Trump-backed plan to redraw Missouri congressional districts draws opposition at first hearing

item.description: Don't rush into opening a $10,000 CD account this month before considering these three savvy moves.

item.title: At least 15 killed in funicular rail car crash in Lisbon, Portugal
item.description: The cause of the deadly crash remains unclear after an electric streetcar derailed in Lisbon, Portugal.

item.title: US job cuts soared in August, outplacement company says
item.description: Jobs cuts announced by U.S. firms climbed 39% last month, data shows.

item.title: Here's how far mortgage rates have dropped in 2025 (and how much further they can still fall)
item.description: Mortgage interest rates have been falling for much of 2025. Here's how far they've dropped and what to expect next.

item.title: Both Republicans and Democrats clash with RFK Jr. on vaccines, CDC turmoil
item.description: "We're denying people vaccines," Republican Sen. Bill Cassidy told Kennedy.
